title: chartsqa
author: chartsqa
content: I was watching a Youtube video today about the 200 MA, and he refers to the MA 200 as 200 "week" MA not 200 day MA. When I add the SMA to my chart and change the "length" field to 200 I get a totally different outcome to what he has on the video.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SlkrfSNl9DUWhen I add 200 day sma to my chart I get a totally different result. Surely the figure for "length" is days not weeks?https://postimg.cc/7f7PvyCW

comments.author: dbshck
comments.body: The "length" depends on the timeframe of the chart that you're using. If you're on the weekly chart, then 200 length on SMA will be a 200 Week SMA. Here's my attempt to recreate that line, I think its quite similar:Edit: Just realized you can edit the timeframe with the Timeframe dropdown. If you choose "Chart", it will use the same timeframe as the chart. Just change the timeframe to 1 week and you'll get 200 Week SMA.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Could you please share a full screenshot of your chart?I think you are using a different time interval on your chart, like 1hr or 1 day. If that's the case, you will get a different result from that in the video. The video author's chart is on a weekly interval, which means his 200 MA means 200 weekly MAIf his chart is on a daily interval, that would mean the MA shown would be 200 Daily MA
